Description: Upper body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with two added white bands; exterior: paired hook maeander pattern at rim (now lost), running left; below, painted decoration consisting of part of grazing goat (neck, ear and horn remaining) to right; pendant roundel and rosette as filling ornament.
Producer name: Attributed to: Group of the Aphrodite Bowl
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as part of the Group of the Aphrodite Bowl, rather than the painter of the bowl, because the sherd displays a greater amount of variety in the filling ornaments, albeit similar to those on the Aphrodite Bowl (Lemos 1991, 74-5).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 74, p. 237, no. 164, pl. 15)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0375) (phase 2)
